entities.name: mafalda
entities.description: Mafalda is a person who works for the Ministry, specifically in record-keeping. She is mentioned as being able to be spared for this task.

entities.name: umbridge
entities.description: Umbridge is a person who is part of the Muggleborn Registration Commission, and she speaks with the Minister. She has a clipboard and is in charge of record-keeping.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is a person who is sent by Travers, and she speaks with Umbridge. She is mentioned as being able to do the task well.

entities.name: travers
entities.description: Travers is a person who sends Hermione to speak with Umbridge. He is not physically present in the scene, but his name is mentioned as being involved in the task.

entities.name: minister
entities.description: The Minister is a person who speaks with Umbridge over the phone. He is not physically present in the scene, but his name is mentioned as being involved in the task.

entities.name: runcorn
entities.description: Runcorn is a person who has a deep voice and is impersonated by Harry. He is not physically present in the scene, but his name is mentioned as being involved in the task.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a person who impersonates Runcorn's voice and steps out of the lift. He is not directly involved in the conversation, but his presence is mentioned.

entities.name: muggleborn registration commission
entities.description: The Muggleborn Registration Commission is an organization that Umbridge and others are part of. It is mentioned as being involved in record-keeping and other tasks.

relationships.description: Umbridge speaks to Mafalda, instructing her on what to do. This is mentioned in the line 'We’ll go straight down, Mafalda, and you’ll find everything you need in the courtroom.'
Umbridge speaks to the Minister over the phone. This is mentioned in the line 'Travers sent you, did he?'
Umbridge speaks to Hermione, asking her if Travers sent her. This is mentioned in the line 'Ah,Mafalda!’ said Umbridge, looking at Hermione.
Harry impersonates Runcorn's voice. This is mentioned in the line 'Yes, of course,’ said Harry in Runcorn’s deep voice.'
